primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God interrupts human hopelessness and the cycle of sin/idolatry by invading history to create a 'new thing' (resurrection and redemption) out of nothing.

tekstueel_bewijs: I am doing a new thing!
He puts redemption into our blanket.

object.identificatie: New Life / Redemption / The New Creation
tekstueel_bewijs: water where there was no water

zender.identificatie: God's own nature / The Future of God
tekstueel_bewijs: for my own sake I will remember your former condition no more
dependent not upon our merits but upon his own nature

ontvanger.identificatie: The Exiles / The Hearer / The Hopeless
tekstueel_bewijs: O Israel, you will not be forgotten by me
Jesus stoops down to us in our miserable condition
the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all
paying in his own body the price of sin
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (God invading from the future)

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Idolatry, and the 'Normal Progression of Things'
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as a sphere of power (the past/death) that only a divine invasion can overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Human attempts to 'turn themselves around' or balance moral ledgers.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Addict / The Legalist
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is exposed as a failure (idolatry/hopelessness) which is superseded by the primary program of Grace.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Nature → New Life → The Hopeless

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will interrupt the normal progression.
He puts redemption into our blanket.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We chase after this new thing.
She had been taught to add up her faults.

voorbeelden: she didn’t have to do it anymore
we hope for from the future
hidden things which you have not known
God’s power to call a new creation into being
sphere of power capable of calling into existence the things that do not exist

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses entirely on God's 'Ability' (Pouvoir) in the face of human 'Inability'. It is a theology of divine capacity.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (No New Life), moves to ~S1 (the failure of moral ledgers), and is resolved by S1 (God's invasion).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'New Thing' which is the Cross—God taking S2 upon Himself.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon emphasizes the total loss of home, nation, and identity in exile.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently positions God as the active Subject and the human as the passive Receiver of a gift that cannot be self-generated.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as active Subject of verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has become man... He just gives the gift.
He does not ask us what we are doing to make ourselves better; he just gives the gift.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as models for behavior but as recipients of God's action.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon treats Israel's exile as a state of death requiring resurrection, not a moral example to follow.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and hope; removal of the burden of self-justification.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God is the sole author of the 'New Thing'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the Old Testament promise to the New Testament fulfillment in Christ is structurally seamless.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: paying in his own body the price of sin

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the Christological endowment of new life rather than the indwelling Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a 'corrupting past' and 'idolatry' that renders humans 'less than nothing'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of theocentric narrative structure where God is the Subject and the human is the Receiver.

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The hearer is correctly positioned as the 'exile' or 'addict' receiving a gift.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Could slightly increase Vouloir (the hearer's response of 'Singing a new song').
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Expand on what 'Singing to the Lord a new song' looks like as a response to the gift.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as death and hopelessness.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's act) correctly precedes and grounds the response.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully avoids the trap of moralism by making God the sole agent of the 'New Thing'. The use of the Port Authority illustration perfectly mirrors the actantial role of the Receiver.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'New!' advertising hook, Greimas reveals that 'New' functions as the Object of Value that only the Divine Subject can provide.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Babylonian context; Greimas shows how that context creates a 'lack' (S2) that necessitates a specific actantial movement.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'idols' are failed Subjects/Helpers, emphasizing that the conflict is not just between people, but between competing 'powers' of creation.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (delivered, will interrupt, is doing, blots out, remembers, comes, stoops, gives, puts)
Israel (suffered, had forsaken, will not be forgotten)
Idols (cannot save, have nothing to say)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'No New Life' calendar typo as a brilliant semiotic marker for the state of S2 (Contrary of Grace).
